page.title: 13CHELMSFORD NURSING HOME
page.content: The house has been a nursing home for three years. Originally it was a home for naughty girls. The oldest person there is 96 and she enjoys reading. The youngest is 66 and he is bed-ridden. Most of the people are disabled and some have to use electric wheelchairs. There is a special chair lift, to help the old people up and down the stairs. They have a bath which has a whirl pool action. There is a lady who comes in at the weekends to help them knit and make pictures etc. There is a full-time staff of 6 and about 30 part-time staff. The old people are allowed to choose their breakfast and tea, but they have a set meal for lunch. The house is very attractive with flowers and pot plants in all the rooms and each bedroom has its own T.V
